taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe astereae;genus symphyotrichum;subgenus virgulus;species patens;variety patens

bio:treatment.description: Plants robust. Involucres campanulate, 5.5–7.5 mm. Phyllaries in 4–5 series, squarrose, acute to acuminate, sparsely strigillose, densely stipitate-glandular; mid 1–1.2 mm wide. 2n = 10, 20.
Sandy, loamy, shaley, or clayey soils, dry woods, open oak and pine woods, fields, roadsides, disturbed habitats;
Ala., Ark., Conn., Del., D.C., Fla., Ga., Ill., Ind., Kans., Ky., La., Maine, Md., Mass., Miss., Mo., N.H., N.J., N.Y., N.C., Ohio, Okla., Pa., R.I., S.C., Tenn., Tex., Va., W.Va.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety patens is found in the southern Central Lowland, the Appalachian Mountains, the Piedmont, and the Coastal Plains. Aster patens forma rosea Svenson is a color morph that is not recognized here.
